intro: Aristeyera, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Aristeyera has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. It is native to the southeastern United States and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
